articles.headline: For the Wealthiest, a Private Tax System That Saves Them Billions
articles.snippet: The very richest are able to quietly shape tax policy that will allow them to shield billions in income.
articles.abstract: The very richest are able to quietly shape tax policy that will allow them to shield billions in income.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The hedge fund magnates Daniel S. Loeb, Louis Moore Bacon and Steven A. Cohen have much in common. They have managed billions of dollars in capital, earning vast fortunes. They have invested large sums in art — and millions more in political candidates.
articles.byline: By Noam Scheiber and Patricia Cohen

articles.headline: A Plan to Untangle Philadelphia’s Daunting Decay
articles.snippet: The Land Bank may help clear urban blight in ways that conform with neighborhood and city plans, but some residents fear they will be priced out.
articles.abstract: The Land Bank may help clear urban blight in ways that conform with neighborhood and city plans, but some residents fear they will be priced out.
articles.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA — To have any hope of reviving this city’s many blighted streets, developers would have to purchase property like 1913 North 24th Street, an empty lot that is still officially owned by a man who died in 1969.

articles.headline: Town Where the Tomato Is King Rallies to Save Its Heinz Plant
articles.snippet: After the investors, including Warren Buffett, who bought Heinz said they would close the tomato plant in Leamington, Ontario, new owners kept it running.
articles.abstract: After the investors, including Warren Buffett, who bought Heinz said they would close the tomato plant in Leamington, Ontario, new owners kept it running.
articles.lead_paragraph: LEAMINGTON, Ontario — Heinz has left a deep mark on this town, the self-proclaimed “tomato capital of Canada” that sits on the shore of Lake Erie.

articles.headline: Twitter Names Jeffrey Siminoff as New Diversity Chief
articles.snippet: Mr. Siminoff replaces Janet Van Huysse, ending a year in which the company was criticized about its minority hiring.
articles.abstract: Mr. Siminoff replaces Janet Van Huysse, ending a year in which the company was criticized about its minority hiring.
articles.lead_paragraph: At the end of a year in which it was regularly criticized for a lack of diversity in its work force, Twitter, the social media service, has put a new executive in charge of dealing with the issue.

articles.headline: Puerto Rico Debt Crisis Closes In on Jan. 1 Deadline
articles.snippet: Exactly which payments the island will have to skip remained unclear, but the United States Treasury secretary said the island was already effectively in default.
articles.abstract: Exactly which payments the island will have to skip remained unclear, but the United States Treasury secretary said the island was already effectively in default.
articles.lead_paragraph: Running out of both time and money, debt-ridden Puerto Rico appears headed for default on at least some of the roughly $1 billion in bond payments that are due on Jan. 1.

articles.headline: Ex-Ally Donald Trump Now Heaps Scorn on Bill Clinton
articles.snippet: Donald J. Trump once defended Bill Clinton against allegations of scandal and sexism. But in the past week, any semblance of friendship ended.
articles.abstract: Donald J. Trump once defended Bill Clinton against allegations of scandal and sexism. But in the past week, any semblance of friendship ended.
articles.lead_paragraph: For years, President Bill Clinton was the best friend Donald J. Trump always hoped to have.

articles.headline: A Chinese Company in India, Stumbling Over a Culture
articles.snippet: Three years ago, Beiqi Foton Motor, a truck manufacturer, secured 250 acres of farmland in an Indian village, causing a ripple effect with religious, political and socioeconomic repercussions.
articles.abstract: Three years ago, Beiqi Foton Motor, a truck manufacturer, secured 250 acres of farmland in an Indian village, causing a ripple effect with religious, political and socioeconomic repercussions.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHINDE, India — When a Chinese truck company wanted to open a factory in India, its president looked at sites that had a mountain in back and a river in front — especially auspicious locations in the traditional practice of feng shui.

articles.headline: Alarm Spreads in Brazil Over a Virus and a Surge in Malformed Infants
articles.snippet: The mosquito-borne Zika virus, suspected of fueling a spike in microcephaly, is at the core of one of the most alarming Brazilian health crises in decades.
articles.abstract: The mosquito-borne Zika virus, suspected of fueling a spike in microcephaly, is at the core of one of the most alarming Brazilian health crises in decades.
articles.lead_paragraph: SÃO PAULO, Brazil — A little-known virus spread by mosquitoes is causing one of the most alarming health crises to hit Brazil in decades, officials here warn: thousands of cases of brain damage, in which babies are born with unusually small heads.

articles.headline: New Hampshire Independents May Control Fates of Trump and Sanders
articles.snippet: The state’s large bloc of undeclared voters can participate in either primary. Donald J. Trump and Bernie Sanders, in particular, are counting on them.
articles.abstract: The state’s large bloc of undeclared voters can participate in either primary. Donald J. Trump and Bernie Sanders, in particular, are counting on them.
articles.lead_paragraph: ROCHESTER, N.H. — There are few titles in American democracy as privileged as “undeclared New Hampshire voter.”
articles.byline: By Patrick Healy and Matt Flegenheimer

articles.headline: Enter the Shoe Aisle, Feel Your Phone Buzz With a Personal Deal
articles.snippet: Technology can filter shoppers’ preferences and let retailers send personalized alerts about discounts and sales to those who have downloaded the store’s mobile app.
articles.abstract: Technology can filter shoppers’ preferences and let retailers send personalized alerts about discounts and sales to those who have downloaded the store’s mobile app.
articles.lead_paragraph: During a preholiday shopping trip to New York, Lisa Libretto received an enticing alert on her iPhone: an offer for a $25 discount on a Vince Camuto handbag that she had coveted on the retailer’s website.

articles.headline: Bill Cosby Charged in Sexual Assault Case
articles.snippet: The comedian, who has for decades been pursued by allegations of sexual misconduct, was charged with sexual assault in Pennsylvania in a case that many people, including women who had come forward, thought prosecutors would never bring.
articles.abstract: The comedian, who has for decades been pursued by allegations of sexual misconduct, was charged with sexual assault in Pennsylvania in a case that many people, including women who had come forward, thought prosecutors would never bring.
articles.lead_paragraph: Bill Cosby, who has for decades been pursued by allegations of sexual misconduct, was charged with sexual assault in Pennsylvania on Wednesday in a case that many people, including women who had come forward publicly, long thought prosecutors would never bring.
articles.byline: By Sydney Ember and Graham Bowley
